intro: Anthistiria australis, commonly known as the Australian anthistiria, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of white hair. It produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Anthistiria australis is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in sandy soils in coastal regions.
